paper_title.ja: 中空糸を利用したハイブリッド型人工臓器の開発（共著）
細胞大量培養（第6編）（共著）
肝細胞組織体の新規形成法と肝小葉類似構造を有する新規人工肝臓モジュールの開発（共著）

description.ja: 分散状態の培養肝細胞を組織化するオルガノイド誘導法と,長期機能維持を達成できる肝小葉類似構造の概念を取り入れた,新しい人工肝臓モジュールを開発した.物質透過性の良好な中空糸6本でできた中空糸パンドルを作製し,遠心力によって中空糸パンドル内部にラット肝細胞を充填し,旋回培養した.その結果,表面が平滑化した円柱状の肝細胞オルガノイド(シリンドロイド)を形成し,5ヵ月以上,高いレベルでアンモニア除去やアルブミン合成などの機能を維持した.モジュール培養では,肝細胞は規則的に配管された中空糸の外部空間で,lotus root状オルガノイドを形成し,従来の中空型モジュールに比べて3-5倍の肝機能発現を1ヵ月以上維持した

paper_title.ja: 高分子ブレンドの流動を伴う相分離過程の数値シミュレーションの試み（共著）
paper_title.en: Numerical Simulation of Phase Structure Development in Simple Shear Flow of Polymer Blends

description.ja: Flowing meso-phase structures of binary polymer blends with and without viscoelastic features are simulated using a two fluid model with modified Cahn-Hilliard equation and double reptation mixing rule. The calculated system is thermodynamically unstable under quiescent conditions and tends to separate into two phases automatically. The modified Cahn-Hilliard model with viscoelastic network stress in simple shear flow predicts that phase separation leads to a co-continuous structure at early time and then decomposes into a layered structure, that is mixed in flow direction and separated into two phases in shear direction at near steady state. Furthermore, the ratio of shear modulus between a droplet and surrounding matrix influences the nature of the layer structure attained at steady state. When the droplet's shear modulus is larger than that of the matrix phase, the droplet causes a layer structure perpendicular to the flow direction.
description.en: Flowing meso-phase structures of binary polymer blends with and without viscoelastic features are simulated using a two fluid model with modified Cahn-Hilliard equation and double reptation mixing rule. The calculated system is thermodynamically unstable under quiescent conditions and tends to separate into two phases automatically. The modified Cahn-Hilliard model with viscoelastic network stress in simple shear flow predicts that phase separation leads to a co-continuous structure at early time and then decomposes into a layered structure, that is mixed in flow direction and separated into two phases in shear direction at near steady state. Furthermore, the ratio of shear modulus between a droplet and surrounding matrix influences the nature of the layer structure attained at steady state. When the droplet's shear modulus is larger than that of the matrix phase, the droplet causes a layer structure perpendicular to the flow direction.
